Class.name: PApplet
Class.span: Represents an interactive animation that runs in the Pygame window and is modelled on Processingâ€™s PApplet class. Sketch and Environment are subclasses which extend PApplet.

Method.name: PApplet(setup, draw, eventMap)
Method.span: The constructor creates a PApplet instance. Use the run method to run the sketch.
Method.Arg: An unbound function that initializes the sketch. A reference to the sketch.
An unbound function that draws one frame of the animation. A reference to the sketch.

Arg.name: eventMap
Arg.span: A dictionary that maps event types or classes (keys) to handler functions (values). You can use None as a key to specify a handler for events that do not have a custom handler.

Class.Method: Set the sketch background. An image to be used for the sketch background. The sketch aspect ratio will be locked (except when maximized) to match the background image. A color to be drawn as the background. If both arguments are given, the image will be blitted onto a background of the specified color.

Run the sketch. The initial size of the sketch in pixels. A string specifying the caption for the sketch window. The path to an image to be used as the window icon. Change to 0 to make the sketch non-resizable.

PropR.name: frameCount
PropR.span: The total number of frames that have been drawn (including the current frame).

PropR.name: draw
PropR.span: A reference to the current drawing function; set by the constructor to the function passed as the draw argument.

PropR.name: eventMap
PropR.span: A dictionary that maps event types (keys) to handler functions (values); set by the constructor to the dictionary passed as the eventMap argument.
